feed.title: 黑客新闻摘要; ;https://hackernews.betacat.io/feed.xml; ;2023-06-12T04:04:17.700535Z; ; ; ; ;polyrabbit; ;https://github.com/polyrabbit/; ; ;Werkzeug; ; ;英特尔全力支持背面供电</stitle>; <id>;https://spectrum.ieee.org/backside-power-delivery</id>; <updated>;2023 -06-11T23:03:00.205817Z</updated>; <link href="https://spectrum.ieee.org/backside-power-delivery"/>; <author>; <name>;mfiguiere</name>; <uri>; https://news.ycombinator.com/user?id=mfiguiere</uri>; </author>; <content type="html">;<img src="https://spectrum.ieee.org/media-library/灰色块的尺寸向细水平白线方向减小，然后再次向图像顶部方向增大.jpg?id= 33959767&width=1200&height=900" style="width: 220px; height: 166px;" />;<br />;英特尔已经构建并测试了处理器内核，这些处理器内核由其当前一代的晶体管与 PowerVia 相结合，PowerVia 是一种为芯片供电的新方法，消除了硅下方的所有供电互连。由此产生的核心的频率提升超过 6%，设计更紧凑，功耗降低 30%。<a href="https://hackernews.betacat.io/#intel-is-all-in-on-backside- power-delivery" target="_blank">;[总结]</a>; <a href="https://news.ycombinator.com/item?id=36286370" target="_blank">;[评论]</a >;</content>; </entry>; <entry xml:base="https://hackernews.betacat.io/feed.xml">; <title type="text">;升级我的 Chumby 8 内核第 5 部分：图形</ stitle>; <id>;https://www.downtowndougbrown.com/2023/06/upgrading-my-chumby-8-kernel-part-5-graphics/</id>; <更新>;2023-06-12T03:03: 00.206451Z</updated>; <link href="https://www.downtowndougbrown.com/2023/06/upgrading-my-chumby-8-kernel-part-5-graphics/"/>; <作者>; <名称>; zdw</name>; <uri>;https://news.ycombinator.com/user?id=zdw</uri>; </author>; <content type="html">;<img src="https://www. downtowndougbrown.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/06/garbled-1024x855.jpg" style="width: 220px; height: 184px;" />;<br />;作者升级了 Chumby 设备的内核以使 LCD 正常工作，包括设置帧缓冲区、配置 LCD 控制器和打开背光。他们还探索了使用 Vivante GC300 图形加速器和 etnaviv Linux 开源驱动程序。<a href="https://hackernews.betacat.io/#upgrading-my-chumby-8-kernel-part-5-graphics" target="_blank" >;[summary]</a>;</content>; </entry>; <entry xml:base="https://hackernews.betacat.io/feed.xml">; <title type="text">;MIDI 2.0 驱动支持随 Linux 6.5 一起提供</stitle>; <id>;https://www.phoronix.com/news/MIDI-2.0-Support-Linux-6.5</id>; <updated>;2023-06-11T23:03:00.206926Z< /updated>; <link href="https://www.phoronix.com/news/MIDI-2.0-Support-Linux-6.5"/>; <author>; <name>;rcarmo</name>; <uri>;https:// news.ycombinator.com/user?id=rcarmo</uri>; </author>; <content type="html">;<img src="https://www.phoronix.com/assets/categories/multimedia.webp"样式=“宽度：220px； height: 221px;" />;<br />;Linux 6.5 将包括对 USB 音频和原始 MIDI 驱动程序的 MIDI 2.0 驱动程序支持，声音子系统维护者 Takashi Iwai 添加了大约 6,000 行新代码。MIDI 2.0 提供更高的分辨率，更好的清晰度，以及对广泛使用的音乐设备协议的各种新功能和改进。<a href="https://hackernews.betacat.io/#midi-2-0-driver-support-coming-with-linux-6- 5" target="_blank">;[摘要]</a>; <a href="https://news.ycombinator.com/item?id=36254672" target="_blank">;[评论]</a>;< /content>; </entry>; <entry xml:base="https://hackernews.betacat.io/feed.xml">; <title type="text">;El Paquete Semanal</stitle>; <id>;https:/ /en.wikipedia.org/wiki/El_Paquete_Semanal</id>; <更新>;2023-06-11T23:03:00.207381Z</更新>; <link href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/El_Paquete_Semanal" />; <author>; <name>;jrott</name>; <uri>;https://news.ycombinator.com/user?id=jrott</uri>; </author>; <content type="html">;El Paquete Semanal是在古巴的地下市场上分发的 1 TB 数字材料集合，作为宽带互联网的替代品。它包含电视连续剧、肥皂剧、音乐、电影和非法分类广告，以及视频剪辑、西班牙语新闻网站、计算机技术网站、教学视频、软件和古巴当地企业的广告。 <a href="https://hackernews.betacat.io/#el-paquete-semanal" target="_blank">;[摘要]</a>; <a href="https://news.ycombinator.com/ item?id=36285363" target="_blank">;[评论]</a>;</content>; </entry>; <entry xml:base="https://hackernews.betacat.io/feed.xml">; < title type="text">;如何使用稳定扩散制作二维码</stitle>; <id>;https://stable-diffusion-art.com/qr-code/</id>; <updated>;2023-06- 11T22:03:00.207816Z</updated>; <link href="https://stable-diffusion-art.com/qr-code/"/>; <author>; <name>;andrewon</name>; <uri>;https: //news.ycombinator.com/user?id=andrewon</uri>; </author>; <content type="html">;<img src="https://i0.wp.com/stable-diffusion-art. com/wp-content/uploads/2023/06/image-53.png?fit=768%2C768&ssl=1" style="宽度：220px；高度：220px；" />;<br />;人们已经想出了如何使用名为 AUTOMATIC1111 的 GUI 在没有自定义模型的情况下使用 Stable Diffusion 制作 QR 码。成功率约为四分之一，具体取决于所使用的提示。 <a href="https://hackernews.betacat.io/#how-to-make-a-qr-code-with-stable-diffusion" target="_blank">;[摘要]</a>; <a href ="https://news.ycombinator.com/item?id=36285630" target="_blank">;[评论]</a>;</content>; </entry>; <entry xml:base="https:// hackernews.betacat.io/feed.xml">; <title type="text">;UTF-21，一种玩具字符编码</stitle>; <id>;https://evanhahn.com/utf-21/</id>; <updated>;2023-06-12T02:03:00.208248Z</updated>; <link href="https://evanhahn.com/utf-21/"/>; <author>; <name>;samwillis</name>; <uri >;https://news.ycombinator.com/user?id=samwillis</uri>; </author>; <content type="html">;文章解释了字符编码和 Unicode 的工作原理，重点介绍了 UTF-21，作者创建的玩具字符编码。 UTF-21 使用 21 位数据来表示每个字符，使其比 UTF-32 更高效，但在大多数情况下不如 UTF-8 和 UTF-16。 <a href="https://hackernews.betacat.io/#utf-21-a-toy-character-encoding" target="_blank">;[摘要]</a>; <a href="https:// news.ycombinator.com/item?id=36269343" target="_blank">;[评论]</a>;</content>; </entry>; <entry xml:base="https://hackernews.betacat.io/ feed.xml">; <title type="text">;在 ImageEngine 上针对 AVIF 测试的 JPEG XL</stitle>; <id>;https://mastodon.online/@jonarnes/110514451857948151</id>; <updated>;2023-06- 11T18:03:00.208709Z</updated>; <link href="https://mastodon.online/@jonarnes/110514451857948151"/>; <author>; <name>;ksec</name>; <uri>;https://news. ycombinator.com/user?id=ksec</uri>; </author>; <内容类型="html">;<img src="https://files.mastodon.online/media_attachments/files/110/514/449/ 182/998/022/original/c48e114fc520cc11.png" style="宽度：220px；高度：132px；" />;<br />;根据在 ImageEngine 上进行的初步测试，JPEG XL 在文件大小减小和视觉质量方面优于 AVIF。 <a href="https://hackernews.betacat.io/#jpeg-xl-against-avif-tested-on-imageengine" target="_blank">;[摘要]</a>; <a href="https: //news.ycombinator.com/item?id=36283395" target="_blank">;[评论]</a>;</content>; </entry>; <entry xml:base="https://hackernews.betacat. io/feed.xml">; <title type="text">;无结构暴政 (1970)</stitle>; <id>;https://www.jofreeman.com/joreen/tyranny.htm</id>; <updated >;2023-06-11T21:03:00.209139Z</updated>; <link href="https://www.jofreeman.com/joreen/tyranny.htm"/>; <author>; <name>;moores</name>; < uri>;https://news.ycombinator.com/user?id=mooreds</uri>; </author>; <content type="html">;文章讨论了妇女解放运动中的“无结构”思想，并认为不可能有一个真正没有结构的群体。作者认为，将一个群体的结构正式化可以防止非正式结构和群体内部精英的形成。 <a href="https://hackernews.betacat.io/#the-tyranny-of-structurelessness-1970" target="_blank">;[摘要]</a>; <a href="https://news. ycombinator.com/item?id=36285097" target="_blank">;[评论]</a>;</content>; </entry>; <entry xml:base="https://hackernews.betacat.io/feed. xml">; <title type="text">;从栈到树：Rust 的新别名模型</stitle>; <id>;https://www.ralfj.de/blog/2023/06/02/tree-borrows .html</id>; <更新>;2023-06-11T20:03:00.209626Z</更新>; <link href="https://www.ralfj.de/blog/2023/06/02/tree-borrows. html"/>; <author>; <name>;obl</name>; <uri>;https://news.ycombinator.com/user?id=obl</uri>; </author>; <content type="html">;Neven正在为 Rust 开发一种名为 Tree Borrows 的新别名模型，旨在解决当前模型 Stacked Borrows 的问题，并为两阶段借用提供适当的支持。 <a href="https://hackernews.betacat.io/#from-stacks-to-trees-a-new-aliasing-model-for-rust" target="_blank">;[总结]</a>; < a href="https://news.ycombinator.com/item?id=36268671" target="_blank">;[评论]</a>;</content>; </entry>; <entry xml:base="https: //hackernews.betacat.io/feed.xml">; <title type="text">;Reddit 对用户进行实验，迫使他们安装应用程序或不使用 Reddit</stitle>; <id>;https://old.reddit .com/r/help/comments/135tly1/helpdid_reddit_just_destroy_mobile_browser_access/</id>; <更新>;2023-06-12T02:03:00.210095Z</更新>; <link href="https://old.reddit.com/r /help/comments/135tly1/helpdid_reddit_just_destroy_mobile_browser_access/"/>; <author>; <name>;xednir</name>; <uri>;https://news.ycombinator.com/user?id=xednir</uri>; </author>; < content type="html">;<img src="https://www.redditstatic.com/new-icon.png" style="width: 220px; height: 220px;" />;<br />;作者对 Reddit 的移动应用程序和该网站对移动用户的敌意，以及该平台让用户注销和恢复设置的倾向表示失望。他们在平台上感到不受欢迎，但仍偶尔访问。 <a href="https://hackernews.betacat.io/#reddit-experiments-on-users-forcing-them-to-install-app-or-else-not-use-reddit" target="_blank">; [总结]</a>; <a href="https://news.ycombinator.com/item?id=36287411" target="_blank">;[评论]</a>;</content>; </entry>; < entry xml:base="https://hackernews.betacat.io/feed.xml">; <title type="text">;一个人完成他十几岁的 Commodore 64 RPG 的 8 位任务</stitle>; <id>;https ://arstechnica.com/gaming/2023/06/one-mans-40-year-8-bit-quest-to-finish-the-c64-rpg-he-started-in-1984/</id>; <更新>;2023-06-11T17:03:00.210617Z</更新>; <link href="https://arstechnica.com/gaming/2023/06/one-mans-40-year-8-bit-quest-to -finish-the-c64-rpg-he-started-in-1984/"/>; <author>; <name>;bookofjoe</name>; <uri>;https://news.ycombinator.com/user?id=bookofjoe< /uri>; </author>; <content type="html">;<img src="https://cdn.arstechnica.net/wp-content/uploads/2023/06/Screenshot-2023-06-09-at- 10.50.04-AM-800x382.png" style="宽度：220px；高度：106px；" />;<br />;Mike Brixius 一直致力于完成他自己的 1984 年 Commodore 64 CRPG，他已经为此工作了将近 40 年。他希望他的 Patreon 支持者和 YouTube 社区能够给予他“道义上的支持和责任感”，让他在这些年后完成自己的比赛。 <a href="https://hackernews.betacat.io/#one-mans-8-bit-quest-to-finish-his-teenage-commodore-64-rpg" target="_blank">;[摘要]< /a>; <a href="https://news.ycombinator.com/item?id=36283003" target="_blank">;[评论]</a>;</content>; </entry>; <entry xml:base ="https://hackernews.betacat.io/feed.xml">; <title type="text">;荷兰政府希望自动获得针对黑客受害者的许可</stitle>; <id>;https://berthub.eu /articles/posts/dutch-intel-law-about-intel/</id>; <updated>;2023-06-11T15:03:00.211175Z</updated>; <link href="https://berthub.eu/articles /posts/dutch-intel-law-about-intel/"/>; <author>; <name>;croes</name>; <uri>;https://news.ycombinator.com/user?id=croes</uri>; < /author>; <content type="html">;<img src="https://berthub.eu/articles/logo3.png" style="宽度：220px；高度：207px；" />;<br />;荷兰政府正在提议一项新法律，自动将逮捕令扩展到黑客攻击受害者，允许情报和安全部门在未经进一步批准的情况下拦截他们的通信或入侵他们。这一增加显着改变了许多权力的范围，也扩大了它们的适用范围，在这些新权力中造成了紧张。 <a href="https://hackernews.betacat.io/#the-dutch-government-wants-automatic-permission-to-target-victims-of-hackers" target="_blank">;[摘要]</a >; <a href="https://news.ycombinator.com/item?id=36281543" target="_blank">;[评论]</a>;</content>; </entry>; <entry xml:base=" https://hackernews.betacat.io/feed.xml">; <title type="text">;拯救印度航空公司在俄罗斯转移的 777 的物流挑战</stitle>; <id>;https://www.flightradar24.com/ blog/air-india-russia-diversion/</id>; <更新>;2023-06-11T21:03:00.211848Z</更新>; <link href="https://www.flightradar24.com/blog/air- india-russia-diversion/"/>; <author>; <name>;dmitrygr</name>; <uri>;https://news.ycombinator.com/user?id=dmitrygr</uri>; </author>; <content type= "html">;<img src="https://www.flightradar24.com/blog/wp-content/uploads/2023/06/VT-ALH.jpg" style="宽度：220px；高度：128px；" />;<br />;印度航空公司从新德里飞往旧金山的173号班机因引擎问题转飞俄罗斯马加丹。乘客在当地一所学校避难，同时派出第二架飞机将他们运送到旧金山。 <a href="https://hackernews.betacat.io/#logistics-challenges-of-saving-air-indias-diverted-777-in-russia" target="_blank">;[摘要]</a>; < a href="https://news.ycombinator.com/item?id=36285049" target="_blank">;[评论]</a>;</content>; </entry>; <entry xml:base="https: //hackernews.betacat.io/feed.xml">; <title type="text">;凸优化——Boyd 和 Vandenberghe [pdf]</stitle>; <id>;https://web.stanford.edu/~boyd/ cvxbook/bv_cvxbook.pdf</id>; <更新>;2023-06-12T00:03:00.212421Z</更新>; <link href="https://web.stanford.edu/~boyd/cvxbook/bv_cvxbook.pdf" />; <author>; <name>;newsoul</name>; <uri>;https://news.ycombinator.com/user?id=newsoul</uri>; </author>; <content type="html">;c(cid :13) 剑桥大学出版社 2004 本出版物受版权保护。除法定例外情况和相关集体许可协议的规定外，未经剑桥大学出版社书面许可，不得复制任何部分。包括参考书目和索引。 ISBN 0 521 83378 7 1. 数学优化。 2.凸函数。 ... <a href="https://hackernews.betacat.io/#convex-optimization-boyd-and-vandenberghe-pdf" target="_blank">;[摘要]</a>; <a href="https ://news.ycombinator.com/item?id=36268320" target="_blank">;[评论]</a>;</content>; </entry>; <entry xml:base="https://hackernews.betacat .io/feed.xml">; <title type="text">;Reddit 罢工已经开始</stitle>; <id>;https://reddark.untone.uk/</id>; <updated>;2023-06-11T18： 03:00.212939Z</updated>; <link href="https://reddark.untone.uk/"/>; <author>; <name>;Freddie111</name>; <uri>;https://news.ycombinator.com/ user?id=Freddie111</uri>; </author>; <content type="html">;由于 reddit 方面的缓慢推出，一些 subreddits 可能会闪烁 public 和 private，如果发生这种情况，则意味着subreddit 只是改变了他们的宣传类型。 <a href="https://hackernews.betacat.io/#reddit-strike-has-started" target="_blank">;[摘要]</a>; <a href="https://news.ycombinator。 com/item?id=36283249" target="_blank">;[评论]</a>;</content>; </entry>; <entry xml:base="https://hackernews.betacat.io/feed.xml" >; <title type="text">;Treebomination：将 scikit-learn 决策树转换为 Keras 模型</stitle>; <id>;https://github.com/Dobiasd/treebomination</id>; <updated>;2023-06 -11T22:03:00.213412Z</updated>; <link href="https://github.com/Dobiasd/treebomination"/>; <author>; <name>;Dobiasd</name>; <uri>;https://news. ycombinator.com/user?id=Dobiasd</uri>; </author>; <content type="html">;<img src="https://raw.githubusercontent.com/Dobiasd/treebomination/main/treebomination.jpg" style="宽度：220px；高度：220px；" />;<br />;Treebomination 是一种将 scikit-learn 决策树转换为 Keras 模型的工具，它通过用两个神经元模拟每个决策节点并初始化权重和偏差以输出与树相似的结果。生成的神经网络具有与原始树相似的精度，但预测时间更快。 <a href="https://hackernews.betacat.io/#treebomination-convert-a-scikit-learn-decision-tree-into-a-keras-model" target="_blank">;[摘要]</a >; <a href="https://news.ycombinator.com/item?id=36282748" target="_blank">;[评论]</a>;</content>; </entry>; <entry xml:base=" https://hackernews.betacat.io/feed.xml">; <title type="text">;文档的惊人力量</stitle>; <id>;https://vadimkravcenko.com/shorts/proper-documentation/< /id>; <更新>;2023-06-12T03:03:00.213851Z</更新>; <link href="https://vadimkravcenko.com/shorts/proper-documentation/"/>; <作者>; <名称>;bndr< /name>; <uri>;https://news.ycombinator.com/user?id=bndr</uri>; </author>; <content type="html">;<img src="https://api.microlink. io?adblock=false&waitForTimeout=1500&meta=false&screenshot&element=%23screenshot&embed=screenshot.url&url=https%3A%2F%2Fcards.microlink.io%2F%3Fpreset%3Dchris-biscardi%26name%3DVadim%2BKravcenko%26subtitle%3DHelping%2Bstartups%2B规模%26title%3DThe%2BSurprising%2BPower%2Bof%2BDocumentation" style="width: 220px; height: 124px;" />;<br />;我是文档的忠实拥护者。我认为这是我编码后最喜欢做的无聊事情。它为业务带来如此多的长期价值，以至于任何人都将每一小时都投入到文档中整个公司节省了 100 倍的工作时间。如果您是 CTO，文档是您的秘密武器，是您创业公司的无名英雄，灰色骑士，它使产品开发落后于产品。它消除了猜测和重新发明轮子. 将其视为您快速入职的金票。这张藏宝图引导其他部门的新人和老手进入您的创业流程的迷宫。您的团队将更快地站稳脚跟，更快地成为有效的贡献者，并开始工作比你预期的更有效，这一切都是因为你决定优先考虑写下东西。给某人写一封电子邮件，将他们从他们的注意力区域中敲出来，要求解释一个软件是如何工作的想象你是一个技术合作 -一家早期创业公司的创始人（或者你甚至不需要想象），正如预期的那样，你陷入了混乱之中。你每天都在玩打地鼠游戏，只是想在陷入另一个问题之前获得一口理智。你如何摆脱这种螺旋？答案很简单——文档。现在，我不只是在谈论维护简单的操作手册或草草记下会议记录；是的，这些也很重要，但我的意思是建立一种文化，在这种文化中，知识不局限于个人，而是分散在整个组织中并可以获取。没有写下来的每一件事都等于浪费了未来的资源，并且有可能让人头疼。你的头痛。我不了解你，但我想确保我没有任何头痛；这就是为什么我喜欢构建没有我也能工作的系统。现在想象一下您还没有写下多少东西，而这就是您目前可能淹没在意想不到的问题中的可能性。例如，您的持续部署因某些包更新而中断。巧合的是，只有 X 部门的 Bob 知道如何解决这个问题。哦，他们整个星期都在度假。您可以将文档视为有效知识共享的本质支柱。在初创公司的早期阶段，当您是唯一的编码和构建人员时，共享信息和见解就像隔着办公桌与您的 CEO 聊天一样简单。如果东西坏了，你有知识和方法来修理它。但这很累人，你基本上是公司的限制因素。如果你去度假——从头开始；你不会去度假，因为如果你去度假，一切都会停止。随着初创企业规模的扩大，人员、项目和复杂性的数量呈指数级增长。知识在你的头脑中变得孤立，沟通变得复杂，在你意识到之前，人们花更多的时间来寻找你的信息而不是实际使用它。如果你是一名技术联合创始人——尽可能地提取每一点知识并将其写下来。这将作为一个普遍的真理来源，一个捕捉和保存集体智慧的动态存储库。这种智慧可以帮助团队中的每个人解决他们一分钟前还不知道如何解决的问题。这也将使您休假。相信我;你需要它。因此，既然您知道文档使您的生活更轻松而不是更艰难，那么让我们来谈谈时间和效率。在初创公司的世界里，时间是最终的货币。时钟的每一个滴答声都承载着做出的决定、制造的产品和征服的市场的分量。会议是臭名昭著的窃取这种货币的小偷。不要误会我的意思。我并不是说所有的会议都是邪恶的，但我们必须严格审查它们的成本和价值。用布考斯基的话来说，“除非它像火箭一样从你的灵魂中冒出来，否则不要这样做，”将相同的原则应用于会议——除非必要，否则不要举行会议。不断需要开会是一个更深层次问题的征兆——缺乏清晰、可访问和可靠的文档。一个有据可查的工作流程不需要一个小时的会议来澄清。一个有据可查的决定不需要满屋子的人来理解它的理由。一个有据可查的知识库不需要在新成员加入团队时进行小组讨论。 "但会议不是交流必不可少的吗？"是的，他们是。但是它们太多，尤其是管理不善的那些，可能会削弱您的创业公司。他们创造了生产力的幻觉，而实际上，他们正在阻碍它。通过减少对会议的依赖并强调文档优先的异步通信，您可以让您的团队有效地进行沟通，而不受 Zoom 通话的限制。想一想：每一次不必要的会议都是一个错失的机会。是时候花时间改进那个关键的算法，或者只是花点时间充电并防止倦怠。从本质上讲，减少对会议的依赖不仅仅是为了节省时间；这是关于重新获得专注、创新和创造的能力——这是初创企业的命脉。作为一名 CTO，经历过初创企业成长的严酷考验的次数多得我都数不过来，我可以向你保证：你的时间和资源最好花在记录上，而不是花在会议上。大多数会议很容易被一份精心起草的文件所取代，该文件提供相关数据和建议的解决方案并征求反馈意见。 💡 会议有一种不成比例的膨胀方式。你召集了一个快速追赶来讨论一个小问题，在你意识到这一点之前，你就卷入了一场关于着陆页 CTA 按钮颜色的长达两个小时的辩论。此外，会议往往倾向于声音最大的人，而不一定是那些有最好想法的人。这是一种微妙的偏见形式，会扼杀创新和思想的多样性。另一方面，文档提供了公平的竞争环境。它为每个团队成员提供了一个平台来表达他们的想法和见解，无论级别或沟通方式如何。它促进了一种深思熟虑和反思的文化，而不是草率的判断和冲动的决定。您可能认为召开一次全公司范围的会议是个好主意，在会议上您宣布将从现在开始将 AI 集成到所有流程中。但是吗？作为快节奏创业公司的一部分，在肾上腺素激增的过程中，细节很容易在旋风中迷失。你提到了一些事情，你开了个玩笑，你含糊不清，沟通不畅，在你意识到之前，你还有另一个问题需要解决。写下决定以及它是如何变得清晰的。每一个决定都是你成长中的初创企业的基础，记录它们可以提供可靠的记录，一种详细说明你的思维过程、关注点和基本原理的架构蓝图。当您扩展规模并面临日益复杂的挑战时，这种清晰度将是无价的。当您将文档引入决策过程时，它充当知识库。它包含每个决定所带来的背景、见解和学习。并且当出现类似情况时可以参考这个存储库。你可以参考他们。这本身就是一种可持续性黑客。现在，作为 CTO，您如何促进这一点？鼓励您的团队记录他们的决策过程，以澄清假设、推理和预期结果。将在会议中讨论这些记录在案的决定作为一种标准做法，促进公开反馈和协作决策的文化。这样做的美妙之处在于，它将每一个决定都变成了一次学习机会，在你的团队中培养了一种成长心态。它让每个人都能看到过去选择的后果，了解背后的考虑，使他们成为更好的决策者。文档至上的文化意味着在您的创业公司中培养一种共同的意识，一种将所有人联系在一起的统一力量。这不仅仅是对过程的严格遵守——它是关于民主化知识、打破等级壁垒和培养学习文化。文档至上的文化并不意味着每个人都整天忙于编写文档。这意味着每个人都欣赏记录和分享他们的经验的价值。当然，这也意味着——在构建项目时，始终将文档作为任何任务的一部分。员工一定比例的时间用于写下他们的故事应该是默认的。这不仅仅是关于效率——而是关于创造一个共享知识的环境。它是关于创造一种文化，这种文化不仅创造产品，而且创造一个故事——一个集体成长的故事。您在其中的角色可以是催化剂和促进者。始终从树立榜样开始。记录您自己的流程和决策并公开分享。随时做笔记。鼓励反馈和学习的文化，其中每个文档都是讨论、改进和创新的起点。如果需要做出决定，请从文件开始，而不是开会。如果有赞成/反对的讨论——从文档开始。 💡 作为 CTO，人们会仰望你，做你做的事。因为你在公司环境中所做的一切都是正确的做法，这是一把双刃剑，所以要小心你为他人树立的榜样。通过鼓励你的同事记录他们的过程、决定和学习，你表明你重视他们的见解和经验。这培养了一种主人翁意识和参与感，超越了他们指定的角色和任务。他们成为公司知识库及其成功的积极贡献者。表扬那些编写好的文档的人。公开分享。祝贺那些像您一样热衷于文档的人。接下来，为您的团队成员提供使文档变得轻而易举的工具。寻找适合您团队需求和工作流程的工具，无论是共享驱动器、概念、Confluence、Gitlab 还是其他一些知识管理平台。有数百个。请记住，您越容易让您的团队记录他们的工作，他们就越有可能这样做。准备模板和指南。将它们视为文档的 DNA - 它们提供结构、一致性和可预测性，使您的知识能够在整个组织中有效地复制和传播。这是一项复杂且耗时的任务，但一旦你掌握了它们，它就会变得更容易。模板确保信息以标准化格式记录，使其易于理解和比较。另一方面，指南提供了“游戏规则”，确保每个人都了解要记录什么、如何做以及在哪里找到它。 💡 创建清单、启动审查流程并设置版本控制。这些工具不是链；它们帮助您的文档以一种声音、一种语气和一种风格说话。将文档作为贵公司价值观的一部分加以推广。鼓励您的团队不要将其视为额外的苦差事，而是将其视为工作中不可或缺的一部分，与编写代码一样重要。使其成为绩效评估和反馈会议的常规部分。要求他们改进它，并要求他们找出您的流程中的缺陷。在初创公司的早期阶段指定一个专门的团队或个人来处理文档似乎有些奢侈。但请相信我，这是您可以做出的最明智的投资之一。为什么？因为知识是您创业的命脉，专门的手册团队充当循环系统，确保这些重要知识在整个组织中自由高效地流动。 💡 不过，它不需要是一个完整的团队。一个人的工作完全专注于改进文档可能是一笔巨大的财富。好处不仅仅是知识管理。您的文档团队可以通过缩小团队之间的差距、促进跨职能协作和打破孤岛来提高整体组织效率。它们就像粘合剂一样将你所有团队的头脑凝聚在一起。不是每个人都会喜欢它。如果你是一家成熟的初创公司，已经有几年的经验，就会遇到阻力。请记住，您不仅仅是在处理代码；你在和人打交道。他们的恐惧、舒适区和犹豫与任何技术错误一样真实。他们需要以同样的耐心来解决。应对阻力最有效的方法之一是参与。倾听您团队的担忧，了解他们的观点，并解决他们的恐惧。向他们展示文档优先文化可以带来的好处、效率和解放。我想重复一遍——模仿你想看到的行为，成为第一个记录、分享、学习并向他们展示它有多棒的人。庆祝那些采用这种文化的人——他们的胜利、努力，以及朝着文档优先方法迈进的步伐。这不仅鼓励他们，也激励其他人效仿。并不是说“不是每个人都会喜欢它”是您唯一的问题。文档本身也不完美，一开始可能会很糟糕。没关系，不要惊慌。请记住，它是一种需要时间进化的活生物体。作为首席技术官，您的职责是确保您的文档质量随着时间的推移而提高。这与警务无关。是关于修炼的。首先，清晰和简洁。它是关于将复杂的概念分解成易于消化的部分，减少脂肪，并专注于重要的事情。您的文档不是冗长的小说；这是其他人需要遵循的指南。然后是结构和组织。您需要一种有意义、直观的格式。 If people can't find what they're looking for, they'll get lost and frustrated. Your document needs to guide them, not confuse them. Next up, accessibility and discoverability. Your document isn't some secret tome hidden in a dusty old library. It'sa living, breathing resource that needs to be easily accessible and discoverable. Lastly, and this is critical, your document isn'ta monument. It's not something you build once and forget about. It'sa growing, evolving entity that needs regular updates and maintenance. Your organization changes, your knowledge expands, and your document needs to reflect that. Here are a few open-source documentation systems that I recommend studying to get some inspiration: Gitlab — Gitlab handbook is 2000 Pages of Documentation that is version-controlled and is constantly updated. Highly recommend reading through it. Strapi - Inspired by the radical transparency of Gitlab, also good documentation to read through. I've been singing the praises of documentation for a while now; thanks for reading this far, by the way. But let me put down my pompoms for a minute: Documentation, while impressive, is not a magical cure-all. It won't swoop in like some superhero and rescue your startup from every problem. It'sa tool; like any tool, it has limitations. You're still going to be dealing with issues… but less. Documentation, while a boon for collaboration, is not a substitute for human interaction. It cannot replicate the nuances of face-to-face communication, the value of immediate feedback, or the bonding when a team huddles together to tackle a tricky problem. The camaraderie built during these meetings or even informal catch-ups is vital for fostering a healthy work culture and driving team motivation. If you swap all human interaction for a series of documents, you're setting up your team for isolation and disconnection, a one-way ticket to low engagement. The process of documenting itself can be time-consuming. There'sa certain art to writing a practical, concise, and easily digestible document. It requires thoughtfulness, clarity of thought, and a knack for simplification. Some might argue that the time spent crafting these documents could be better utilized elsewhere. And they're not entirely wrong. If you're documenting every tiny detail, you will have an overwhelming library of information that's as difficult to navigate as a dense jungle and might not be THAT useful. 🚨 Do you know how sometimes there are articles that have a 2000-word introduction to that one sentence that you need to solve your problem? That's what over-documenting can feel like. Lastly, despite your best efforts, documentation can quickly become outdated. Technology evolves, processes change, and what was relevant a month ago might not be relevant today. Keeping your documentation up to date requires constant vigilance and regular maintenance, which can be challenging for a rapidly growing startup with limited resources. My advice to all the young tech enthusiasts, future engineering managers, and CTOs is simple: cultivate a love for documentation. You may view it as a chore, an afterthought, or a nuisance. But trust me when I say this: Documentation isn't just a task on your to-do list; it'sa pillar for success and a bridge that connects ideas, people, and vision. Treat it not as a burden but as an opportunity to learn, share, and create an impact. Start small, but start today. Don't wait for a grand strategy or a perfect tool. Start by documenting your code, your decisions, and your learnings. Make it a part of your daily workflow, not an end-of-the-day chore. And as you move forward, imbibe this culture of documentation into your teams, your projects, and your organization. Create systems and processes that encourage and facilitate documentation. If there's one thing you can take out from this article, carry this mantra with you: "Document to empower, document to grow." Embrace this philosophy, and you'll be surprised at the transformations it brings, not just in your career but in how you view and navigate the world of technology. 89+ people joined this week You've probably read a few of my articles already, that's the kind of content you should expect in the newsletter. I share my thoughts as a CTO. Some of the topics that I like writing about: building SaaS products, growing teams, scaling technology and in general being a good founder and a decent person. <a href="https://hackernews.betacat.io/#the-surprising-power-of-documentation" target="_blank">;[summary]</a>;</content>; <link href="https://www.techemails.com/p/apple-execs-on-facebook"/>; <author>; <name>;cocacola1</name>; <uri>;https://news.ycombinator.com/user?id=cocacola1</uri>; </author>; <content type="html">;<img src="https://substackcdn.com/image/fetch/w_120,c_limit,f_auto,q_auto:good,fl_progressive:steep/https%3A%2F%2Fbucketeer-e05bbc84-baa3-437e-9518-adb32be77984.s3.amazonaws.com%2Fpublic%2Fimages%2F79fc15fc-6ea8-4426-acad-117e6c349ba0_922x876.png" style="width: 220px; height: 209px;" />;<br />;Apple 高管讨论了是否在 Facebook iPad 应用程序中包含嵌入式应用程序，最终决定不包含应用程序目录，并且只允许新闻源中与应用程序相关的用户帖子。他们还讨论了是否允许链接到不接受 Facebook Credits 或没有本地 iOS 应用程序但要求任何使用 Facebook Credits 的开发人员使用本地应用程序的网站。 <a href="https://hackernews.betacat.io/#apple-execs-on-facebook-2011" target="_blank">;[summary]</a>; <a href="https://news.ycombinator.com/item?id=36285640" target="_blank">;[comments]</a>;</content>; </entry>; <entry xml:base="https://hackernews.betacat.io/feed.xml">; <title type="text">;Domain knowledge or a lack thereof (2013)</stitle>; <id>;https://jacquesmattheij.com/domain-knowledge-or-a-lack-thereof/</id>; <updated>;2023-06-11T20:03:00.214722Z</updated>; <link href="https://jacquesmattheij.com/domain-knowledge-or-a-lack-thereof/"/>; <author>; <name>;ggr2342</name>; <uri>;https://news.ycombinator.com/user?id=ggr2342</uri>; </author>; <content type="html">;Lack of domain knowledge is a major cause of bad software development.获取领域知识对于开发有效的软件至关重要。 <a href="https://hackernews.betacat.io/#domain-knowledge-or-a-lack-thereof-2013" target="_blank">;[summary]</a>; <a href="https://news.ycombinator.com/item?id=36268339" target="_blank">;[comments]</a>;</content>; </entry>; <entry xml:base="https://hackernews.betacat.io/feed.xml">; <title type="text">;A compact overview of JDK 21's “frozen” feature list</stitle>; <id>;https://vived.io/a-compact-overview-of-jdk-21s-frozen-feature-list-jvm-weekly-vol-138/</id>; <updated>;2023-06-11T16:03:00.215512Z</updated>; <link href="https://vived.io/a-compact-overview-of-jdk-21s-frozen-feature-list-jvm-weekly-vol-138/"/>; <author>; <name>;mooreds</name>; <uri>;https://news.ycombinator.com/user?id=mooreds</uri>; </author>; <content type="html">;<img src="https://substackcdn.com/image/fetch/w_1456,c_limit,f_auto,q_auto:good,fl_progressive:steep/https%3A%2F%2Fsubstack-post-media.s3.amazonaws.com%2Fpublic%2Fimages%2F93757923-5d36-4e57-8d29-efaec60f6a02_1456x1048.png" style="width: 220px; height: 159px;" />;<br />;JDK 21 已经进入 Rampdown 阶段，其中包含一系列令人印象深刻的新功能，包括有序集合的一致接口、GC 中短期和长期对象的不同管道，以及轻松破坏记录。 <a href="https://hackernews.betacat.io/#a-compact-overview-of-jdk-21s-frozen-feature-list" target="_blank">;[summary]</a>; <a href="https://news.ycombinator.com/item?id=36282076" target="_blank">;[comments]</a>;</content>; </entry>; <entry xml:base="https://hackernews.betacat.io/feed.xml">; <title type="text">;Show HN: Java REST without annotations, DI nor reactive streams</stitle>; <id>;https://github.com/MartinGeisse/grumpyrest</id>; <updated>;2023-06-11T18:03:00.215956Z</updated>; <link href="https://github.com/MartinGeisse/grumpyrest"/>; <author>; <name>;moring</name>; <uri>;https://news.ycombinator.com/user?id=moring</uri>; </author>; <content type="html">;<img src="https://opengraph.githubassets.com/959b42571a199ddb1b6eb77de36b8a52faa67e6a72ec5d44df951948c5c47a27/MartinGeisse/grumpyrest" style="width: 220px; height: 110px;" />;<br />;Grumpyrest is a Java REST server framework that uses the Java type system instead of annotations, automatic dependency injection, or reactive streams. It also provides tools to tackle potential performance problems and allows developers to avoid them in their application code. <a href="https://hackernews.betacat.io/#show-hn-java-rest-without-annotations-di-nor-reactive-streams" target="_blank">;[summary]</a>; <a href="https://news.ycombinator.com/item?id=36283351" target="_blank">;[comments]</a>;</content>; </entry>; <entry xml:base="https://hackernews.betacat.io/feed.xml">; <title type="text">;Why are blocks on Bluesky public?</stitle>; <id>;https://atproto.com/blog/block-implementation</id>; <updated>;2023-06-11T20:03:00.216409Z</updated>; <link href="https://atproto.com/blog/block-implementation"/>; <author>; <name>;carride</name>; <uri>;https://news.ycombinator.com/user?id=carride</uri>; </author>; <content type="html">;<img src="https://atproto.com/img/default-social-card.jpg" style="width: 220px; height: 115px;" />;<br />;Bluesky's public blocks feature allows for mutual mute and interaction block between two accounts, but does not prevent all possible interaction. Blocks are implemented as part of the app.bsky.* application protocol and are public due to the need for multiple parties to coordinate and enforce the blocking behavior. <a href="https://hackernews.betacat.io/#why-are-blocks-on-bluesky-public" target="_blank">;[summary]</a>; <a href="https://news.ycombinator.com/item?id=36284614" target="_blank">;[comments]</a>;</content>; </entry>; <entry xml:base="https://hackernews.betacat.io/feed.xml">; <title type="text">;The role of eyebrows in face recognition [pdf]</stitle>; <id>;https://web.mit.edu/sinhalab/Papers/sinha_eyebrows.pdf</id>; <updated>;2023-06-12T01:03:00.216855Z</updated>; <link href="https://web.mit.edu/sinhalab/Papers/sinha_eyebrows.pdf"/>; <author>; <name>;stacktrust</name>; <uri>;https://news.ycombinator.com/user?id=stacktrust</uri>; </author>; <content type="html">;The article discusses the role of eyebrows in face recognition, which has received little attention compared to other facial features such as the eyes and mouth. The authors report experimental results suggesting that the absence of eyebrows in familiar faces leads to a significant disruption in recognition performance, indicating that eyebrows may be at least as influential as the eyes in face recognition. <a href="https://hackernews.betacat.io/#the-role-of-eyebrows-in-face-recognition-pdf" target="_blank">;[summary]</a>; <a href="https://news.ycombinator.com/item?id=36278970" target="_blank">;[comments]</a>;</content>; </entry>; <entry xml:base="https://hackernews.betacat.io/feed.xml">; <title type="text">;Csexp: S-Expressions over the Network</stitle>; <id>;https://docs.racket-lang.org/csexp/index.html</id>; <updated>;2023-06-11T17:03:00.217735Z</updated>; <link href="https://docs.racket-lang.org/csexp/index.html"/>; <author>; <name>;thefilmore</name>; <uri>;https://news.ycombinator.com/user?id=thefilmore</uri>; </author>; <content type="html">;Canonical s-expressions (csexp) are a way to format s-expressions into data packets suitable for transmission over a network.这使得读取流中的表达式变得容易，并提供了一种编写给定 s 表达式的独特（规范）方式。 <a href="https://hackernews.betacat.io/#csexp-s-expressions-over-the-network" target="_blank">;[summary]</a>; <a href="https://news.ycombinator.com/item?id=36282798" target="_blank">;[comments]</a>;</content>; </entry>; <entry xml:base="https://hackernews.betacat.io/feed.xml">; <title type="text">;A Brief History of the Corporation: 1600 to 2100 (2011)</stitle>; <id>;https://www.ribbonfarm.com/2011/06/08/a-brief-history-of-the-corporation-1600-to-2100/</id>; <updated>;2023-06-11T18:03:00.218456Z</updated>; <link href="https://www.ribbonfarm.com/2011/06/08/a-brief-history-of-the-corporation-1600-to-2100/"/>; <author>; <name>;simonpure</name>; <uri>;https://news.ycombinator.com/user?id=simonpure</uri>; </author>; <content type="html">;<img src="https://ribbonfarm.wpenginepowered.com/wp-content/uploads/2011/06/fourForces.png" style="width: 220px; height: 161px;" />;<br />;这篇文章讨论了公司的历史，从 1772 年随着英国东印度公司崛起到 21 世纪的最终衰落。作者认为，虽然公司取得了令人难以置信的成就，但它们最终会过时，并被后公司的未来所取代。 <a href="https://hackernews.betacat.io/#a-brief-history-of-the-corporation-1600-to-2100-2011" target="_blank">;[summary]</a>; <a href="https://news.ycombinator.com/item?id=36283638" target="_blank">;[comments]</a>;</content>; </entry>; <entry xml:base="https://hackernews.betacat.io/feed.xml">; <title type="text">;Inside the Wuhan lab weeks before Covid</stitle>; <id>;https://www.thetimes.co.uk/article/inside-wuhan-lab-covid-pandemic-china-america-qhjwwwvm0</id>; <updated>;2023-06-11T04:03:00.218941Z</updated>; <link href="https://www.thetimes.co.uk/article/inside-wuhan-lab-covid-pandemic-china-america-qhjwwwvm0"/>; <author>; <name>;ricksunny</name>; <uri>;https://news.ycombinator.com/user?id=ricksunny</uri>; </author>; <content type="html">;<img src="https://www.thetimes.co.uk/imageserver/image/%2Fmethode%2Fsundaytimes%2Fprod%2Fweb%2Fbin%2F5aedcbf4-06ec-11ee-a1e5-6222cf71d60e.jpg?crop=1575%2C886%2C0%2C0&resize=360" style="width: 220px; height: 124px;" />;<br />;Scientists in Wuhan were allegedly conducting dangerous experiments combining deadly coronaviruses to create a new mutant virus with the Chinese military, which caused a leak from the Wuhan Institute of Virology and started the Covid-19 outbreak. The work was done in collaboration with researchers from the Chinese military, which was funding it and pursuing bioweapons. <a href="https://hackernews.betacat.io/#inside-the-wuhan-lab-weeks-before-covid" target="_blank">;[summary]</a>; <a href="https://news.ycombinator.com/item?id=36276268" target="_blank">;[comments]</a>;</content>; </entry>; <entry xml:base="https://hackernews.betacat.io/feed.xml">; <title type="text">;Writesonic (YC S21) Is Hiring a Digital Marketing Manager</stitle>; <id>;https://www.ycombinator.com/companies/writesonic/jobs/PL99uk8-digital-marketing-manager</id>; <updated>;2023-06-11T17:03:00.219503Z</updated>; <link href="https://www.ycombinator.com/companies/writesonic/jobs/PL99uk8-digital-marketing-manager"/>; <content type="html">;<img src="https://bookface-images.s3.amazonaws.com/small_logos/5c3627a012cbd2927f9d0157663c3668b458fe3e.png" style="width: 220px; height: 220px;" />;<br />;Writesonic 是领先的生成式 AI 平台，拥有超过 500 万用户，彻底改变了内容创作并改变了企业和个人的沟通方式。我们的尖端技术使用户能够轻松创建高质量的原创内容。我们是一家快速发展的创新型公司，正在寻找有才华的人加入我们的团队。我们正在寻找一位实践经验丰富的增长营销经理加入我们的团队。在此职位上，您将领导我们跨多个渠道的营销工作，专注于推动增长和增加收入。您应该具有在 SaaS 环境中制定、执行和优化数字营销活动的经验。制定并实施全面的营销策略，包括搜索引擎优化、付费广告、电子邮件营销、影响者外展、合作伙伴关系、播客等。分析活动绩效和用户参与度以优化活动、进行必要的调整并报告 ROI。紧跟数字营销和 SaaS 行业的最新趋势和变化，并根据需要调整我们的策略。与其他团队成员和部门合作，使我们的营销策略与我们的产品供应和公司总体目标保持一致。 3-5 年增长营销角色的实践经验，最好是在 SaaS 环境中。具有技术背景，能够清楚地理解和解释我们的产品及其优势。 Writesonic 正在构建未来的内容营销平台，以帮助企业使用 AI 编写更好的营销文案。这就像您口袋里有一个撰稿人，随时准备为您提供所需的任何类型的内容 - 从 Facebook 和 Google 广告到登陆页面、产品描述、博客文章、摘要等等。 <a href="https://hackernews.betacat.io/#writesonic-yc-s21-is-hiring-a-digital-marketing-manager" target="_blank">;[summary]</a>;</content>; </entry>; <entry xml:base="https://hackernews.betacat.io/feed.xml">; <title type="text">;Code and Programming Projects</stitle>; <id>;https://www.chrisgregory.me/code</id>; <updated>;2023-06-11T22:03:00.219890Z</updated>; <link href="https://www.chrisgregory.me/code"/>; <author>; <name>;surprisetalk</name>; <uri>;https://news.ycombinator.com/user?id=surprisetalk</uri>; </author>; <content type="html">;<img src="https://storage.googleapis.com/cgme/icons/logo/cg-block-large.jpg" style="width: 220px; height: 220px;" />;<br />;Personal online portfolio <a href="https://hackernews.betacat.io/#code-and-programming-projects" target="_blank">;[summary]</a>; <a href="https://news.ycombinator.com/item?id=36286058" target="_blank">;[comments]</a>;</content>; </entry>; <entry xml:base="https://hackernews.betacat.io/feed.xml">; <title type="text">;Handoff Waste and Taylorism</stitle>; <id>;https://two-wrongs.com/handoff-waste-and-taylorism.html</id>; <updated>;2023-06-11T18:03:00.220631Z</updated>; <link href="https://two-wrongs.com/handoff-waste-and-taylorism.html"/>; <author>; <name>;zdw</name>; <uri>;https://news.ycombinator.com/user?id=zdw</uri>; </author>; <content type="html">;The article discusses the concept of handoff waste in product development organizations, which is caused by the practice of Taylorism or "scientific management".这种浪费可以通过将责任、知识、行动和反馈这四个职能集中在一个人身上来最小化，这个人被称为总工程师或企业家系统设计师。 <a href="https://hackernews.betacat.io/#handoff-waste-and-taylorism" target="_blank">;[summary]</a>; <a href="https://news.ycombinator.com/item?id=36275237" target="_blank">;[comments]</a>;</content>; </entry>; <entry xml:base="https://hackernews.betacat.io/feed.xml">; <title type="text">;Stack Overflow Moderation Strike Update</stitle>; <id>;https://meta.stackexchange.com/questions/390106/moderation-strike-update-data-dumps-choosing-representatives-gpt-data-and-wh</id>; <updated>;2023-06-12T02:03:00.221113Z</updated>; <link href="https://meta.stackexchange.com/questions/390106/moderation-strike-update-data-dumps-choosing-representatives-gpt-data-and-wh"/>; <author>; <name>;jlericson</name>; <uri>;https://news.ycombinator.com/user?id=jlericson</uri>; </author>; <content type="html">;<img src="https://meta.stackexchange.com/Content/Img/teams/teams-illo-free-sidebar-promo.svg?v=47faa659a05e" style="width: 220px; height: 181px;" />;<br />;Stack Exchange staff reached out to strike organizers and asked them to choose three moderator representatives for the strike. A former DBA for Stack Exchange, Inc. disclosed that data dumps have been disabled. <a href="https://hackernews.betacat.io/#stack-overflow-moderation-strike-update" target="_blank">;[summary]</a>; <a href="https://news.ycombinator.com/item?id=36287439" target="_blank">;[comments]</a>;</content>; </entry>; </feed>;
